paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP) with secondary glaucoma

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In Portugal and Japan, the penetrance is higher and symptoms typically develop before the age of 40.
In Portugal and Japan, the penetrance is higher and symptoms typically develop before the age of 40.

functional_data.summary: The TTR gene mutations lead to the production of amyloidogenic proteins that accumulate in tissues.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in families with a history of FAP.
variants.population_frequency: Higher prevalence in specific populations such as Portuguese and Japanese.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical and genetic data.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the significant complications associated with TTR-related FAP.
key_quotes: In Portugal and Japan, the penetrance is higher and symptoms typically develop before the age of 40.
Eight of 16 eyes (50%) of patients with FAP ATTR Val30Met and all eyes (100%) of patients with FAP ATTR Tyr114Cys were classified as surgical failures.

patients.phenotype: familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP) with secondary glaucoma

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Three of five eyes (60%) of patients with FAP ATTR Tyr114Cys had no light perception because of subsequent neovascular glaucoma.

functional_data.summary: The TTR gene mutations lead to the production of amyloidogenic proteins that accumulate in tissues.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in families with a history of FAP.
variants.population_frequency: Rare variant, specific to certain populations.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical and genetic data.
variants.additional_notes: Patients with FAP ATTR Tyr114Cys have a poorer prognosis compared to those with FAP ATTR Val30Met.
key_quotes: Three of five eyes (60%) of patients with FAP ATTR Tyr114Cys had no light perception because of subsequent neovascular glaucoma.

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographic and clinical characteristics of glaucoma patients due to FAP.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants and penetrance were extracted.
